artists.name: The Skatalites
artists.description: Foundational ska band, backing countless Jamaican hits of the 1960s.

artists.name: Prince Buster
artists.description: Ska pioneer, influential producer and singer shaping the early Jamaican sound.

artists.name: Desmond Dekker
artists.description: Ska and rocksteady singer whose global hit 'Israelites' spread Jamaican music worldwide.

artists.name: Celia Cruz
artists.description: Queen of salsa; began her rise to international fame in the 1960s.

artists.name: Beny Moré
artists.description: Legendary bolero and mambo singer, bandleader, and icon of Cuban music.

artists.name: Los Van Van
artists.description: Founded in the late ’60s, became pioneers of songo and modern Cuban dance music.

artists.name: Mighty Sparrow
artists.description: Calypso icon known as the 'Calypso King of the World.'

artists.name: Lord Kitchener
artists.description: Calypso innovator who shaped the genre's international spread.

artists.name: Nemours Jean-Baptiste
artists.description: Creator of compas direct, Haiti’s most influential dance music style.

artists.name: Coupé Cloué
artists.description: Compas guitarist and singer known for humor and social commentary.

artists.name: Ismael Rivera
artists.description: Known as 'El Sonero Mayor,' legendary improvisational salsa singer.

artists.name: Cortijo y su Combo
artists.description: Fused Afro-Caribbean rhythms with modern Latin sounds, precursors to salsa.

artists.name: Lord Panama
artists.description: Calypso pioneer in Panama, brought Caribbean styles into Central America.

artists.name: Luis Enrique Mejía Godoy
artists.description: Nicaraguan folk singer, part of the socially conscious nueva canción movement.
